cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 40 miles SE of St. Croix, U.S. Virgin Islands
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across the Greater Antilles this weekend, then forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico and curve northwest toward the Louisiana–Texas coast by mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central/north-west Gulf Coast near the LA–TX border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands; portions of the Dominican Republic and Haiti; southeastern Bahamas; Turks and Caicos; central Bahamas under watch
weather_observation.warning_coast: Puerto Rico, U.S. & British Virgin Islands, northern & southern coasts of the Dominican Republic, northern Haiti, southeastern Bahamas, Turks & Caicos
weather_observation.impacted_coast: northern Leeward Islands, Puerto Rico, Hispaniola, eastern & central Cuba, then the northern Gulf Coast from Texas to Mississippi
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (Kansas City, MO not listed in wind-probability table; nearest listed points are along the Gulf Coast hundreds of miles south)
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (current guidance suggests <2 in. in Missouri)
weather_observation.wind: Remnant system could bring occasional gusts 25–35 mph late next week
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of moderate rain possible late Aug 27-29; localized river rises
weather_observation.other_hazards: Potential short-term Missouri River level fluctuations from upstream rainfall, minor to moderate navigation slow-downs
